The Physics and Math buildings wereevacuated after a fire on the third floor of the Math building set off alarms at  p.m PERIOD on Wednesday Sept PERIOD  PERIOD The fire was caused by a piece of electrical equipment and was extinguished quickly according to University Media Relations manager Alida Almonte PERIOD

One staff member was transported to the University Hospital for smoke inhalation PERIOD Classes in both the Physics and Math buildings have been cancelled for the rest of the day PERIOD

The damage to the building is currently being assessed and cleanup operations are underway PERIOD

We were sitting in class and no one knew what was going on Robert Brienza a junior physics major said PERIOD I thought it was a drill because we got an email that said there would be a fire drill. the University Police Office of Emergency Management was scheduled to conduct tests of emergency notifications systems at  p.m PERIOD and  p.m PERIOD

UpdateThe cause of the fire is under investigation but it originated in a computer server room according to Director of Campus Emergency Management Lawrence Zacarese PERIOD In addition to the staff member two University Fire Marshals were sent to the hospital for evaluation PERIOD All three have been released PERIOD

Correction September  

A previous version of this article referred to Alida Almonte as a Media Relations officer. her title has been corrected PERIOD
